author: Liang Min
notes: ISO 639-3: onb Also called Lingao (临高) in China. The Lincheng (临城) dialect, which is the prestige/standard one, is used.Source: 梁敏/Liang, Min. 临高語研究/Lingao yu yan jiu (A Study of Lingao). 上海/Shanghai: 上海远东出版社/Shanghai yuan dong chu ban she, 1997.Tones (source does not use 5 or 6 for Lincheng):1 = /213/2 = /55/3 = /33/4 = /11/7 = /33/ - Tone *D8 = /55/ - Tone *D
